column4: yow all, I installed yesterday ubuntu 6.06, but apperently it is better to install 7.10. However, I am experiencing some problems now witht he boot disk of 7.10 . I burned one myself. With some tweaks I am able to get the basic screen where i can choose to install, check the CD for errors etc. However, if I choose install, it finally gives a black screen with white letters only, where the...
...only thing I can do is typing some apperently linux commands, which are totally not clear to me...
could anyone help me how I can move on from that screen?
did you get any error messages or anything?
odd, sounds like it just took you to a shell
